contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary}} '''Brainstorm''' generally refers to [[brainstorming]], a group or individual creativity exercise. '''Brainstorm''' may also refer to: ==Film== * [[Brainstorm (1983 film)|''Brainstorm'' (1983 film)]], directed by Douglas Trumbull * [[Brainstorm (1965 film)|''Brainstorm'' (1965 film)]], directed by William Conrad * ''Brainstorm'', English title of the 2001 movie ''[[Bicho de Sete CabeÃ§as]]'' * ''Brainstorm'', alternate title of the 2002 movie ''[[Cypher (film)|Cypher]]'' ==Music== * Artists ** [[Brainstorm (Latvian band)]] ** [[Brainstorm (German band)]] ** [[Brainstorm (US band)]] ** [[Brainstorm (Australian band)]] ** Brainstorm, a rapper with [[Brothers Grym]] ** Brainstorm, one of the pseudonyms used by the musician [[Moby]] * Albums ** [[Brainstorm (album)|''Brainstorm'' (album)]], a 1991 album by rapper Young MC ** [[Brainstorm (EP)|''Brainstorm'' (EP)]], the first extended play by Disney star Mitchel Musso * Songs ** "Brainstorm", a song by Hawkwind from their 1972 album ''[[Doremi Fasol Latido]]'' ** "Brainstorm", a song by Kevin Ayers from his 2007 album ''[[The Unfairground]]'' ** "Brainstorm", a song by Morbid Angel from their 1991 album ''[[Blessed are the Sick]]'' ==Fictional characters== * [[Headmaster (Transformers)#Transformers: Generation 1|Brainstorm (Transformers)]], an Autobot [[Headmaster (Transformers)|Headmaster]] in the Transformers fiction * [[List of Ben 10 aliens#Brainstorm|Brainstorm]] an alien that the main character Ben Tennyson can turn into in the Cartoon Network series ''[[Ben 10: Alien Force]]'' and ''[[Ben 10: Ultimate Alien]]''. ==Other== * [[Brainstorm (TV series)|''Brainstorm'' (TV series)]], a BBC television comedy quiz * [[Brainstorm (board game)|''Brainstorm'' (board game)]], a quiz-style board game ==See also== * "[[Brianstorm]]", a 2007 single by the Arctic Monkeys; a play on the name Brian * [[Professor Branestawm]], a fictional professor serialized in the novels of Norman Hunter {{disambig}}
